poem:
"Certified Uncertainty"

Papered by politics,
Massimiliano, man of Venice born,
Held, then hurled wide by a Briton storm.
Detained in dawn's harsh light,
From Ukraine love's delight, torn.
This, then, is Brexit's mournful morn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Italian man removed from UK despite post-Brexit Home Office certificate An Italian man has been removed from the UK despite holding a Home Office certificate explicitly stating he has a right to travel in and out of the country while officials process his application to live and work in the country post-Brexit. Massimiliano Melargo, 27, told how he was detained overnight, separated from his Ukrainian partner, and put on the first plane to Venice by". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
